hypothesis_content.title: Media Narrative Divergence - Headline vs Price Action
hypothesis_content.statement: When major financial media (Bloomberg, CNBC, CoinDesk) run 3+ consecutive 'bearish' crypto headlines while price holds key support levels, a contrarian rally of 6-10% occurs within 5-7 trading days as narratives catch down to price.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News cycle often lags price action. Persistent negative headlines while price holds indicate weak hands shaken out, setting stage for rally when narrative eventually catches up. Current news about contrarian signals supports this dynamic.
entry_conditions: Media sentiment score (headline analysis) ≤ 0.3 for 3 consecutive days
BTC holds above prior week's low by ≥ 1.5%
On-chain exchange outflow ratio ≥ 1.2 (more leaving exchanges)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Media sentiment flips to ≥ 0.6 OR price gains 8%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below prior week's low by >2%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price breaks support despite media negativity OR media remains negative through entire period with no rally.
